A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Killing\, rather than extending or paying off\, intriguing setups from its predecessor\, presenting one story-logic inconsistency or frivolous subplot after another\, and\, least forgivably\, wastefully disposing of the most beloved film hero of this generation\, \"The Last Jedi\" will come to be regarded as every bit the misstep as any of the prequel films--a case study in how not to write a story.
